item.title: Passwordless SSH key-based authentication
item.description: To generate public/private pair of keys enter: ssh-keygen -b 4096 -t rsa -C "username@email" Next step is to copy key to the remote server: ssh-copy-id -i .ssh/id_rsa.pub user01@server2.example.com On remote server is adviceable to edit /etc/ssh/sshd_config: PasswordAuthentication no PubkeyAuthentication yes PermitRootLogin no Restart the sshd service: systemctl restart sshd And try to login: ssh server2.example.com Done!
